greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations of the multiset {1,1,1,2,2,2,3,3,3,...,n,n,n} with no two consecutive terms equal.
link: Andrew Woods, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..101
H. Eriksson, A. Martin, Enumeration of Carlitz multipermutations, arXiv:1702.04177 [math.CO], 2017.
example: a(2) = 2 because there are two permutations of {1,1,1,2,2,2} avoiding equal consecutive terms: 121212 and 212121.
mathematica: a[n_] := 1/6^n Sum[(n+j)! Sum[Binomial[n, k] Binomial[2k, j] (-3)^(n+k-j), {k, Ceiling[j/2], n}], {j, 0, 2n}];  Table[a[n], {n, 0, 13}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 22 2017, after _Tani Akinari_ *)
program: print([a(n) for n in range(51)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 22 2017, formula after Maple code
xref: Cf. A114938 = similar with two copies instead of three.
Cf. A193624 = arrangements of triples with no adjacent siblings; A193624(n) = 6^n * a(n).
results.author: _Andrew Woods_, Aug 01 2011
